ai-mn27:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn27:2.1_0: Now at that time the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi drove out from Sāvatthī in the middle of the day in an all-white chariot drawn by mares.
ai-mn27:2.2_0: He saw the wanderer Miṇiya coming off in the distance,
ai-mn27:2.4_0: “So, Vaccha, where have you come from in the middle of the day?”
ai-mn27:2.5_0: “Just now, good sir, I’ve come from the presence of the ascetic Gotama.”
ai-mn27:2.6_0: “What do you think of the ascetic Gotama’s lucidity of wisdom? Do you think he’s astute?”
ai-mn27:2.7_0: “Who am I to know who the ascetic Gotama’s lucidity of wisdom?
ai-mn27:2.8_0: You’d really have to be on the same level to judge his lucidity of wisdom.”
ai-mn27:2.9_0: “Master Vacchāyana praises the ascetic Gotama with lofty praise indeed.”
ai-mn27:2.10_0: “Who am I to praise the ascetic Gotama?
ai-mn27:2.11_0: He is praised by the praised as the first among gods and humans.”
ai-mn27:2.12_0: “But for what reason are you so devoted to the ascetic Gotama?”
ai-mn27:3.1_0: “Suppose that a skilled elephant tracker were to enter an elephant wood.
ai-mn27:3.2_0: There he’d see a large elephant’s footprint, long and broad.
ai-mn27:3.4_0: ‘This must be a big bull elephant.’
ai-mn27:3.5_0: In the same way, when I saw these four footprints of the ascetic Gotama that I drew the conclusion,
ai-mn27:3.6_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha. The teaching is well explained. The Saṅgha is practicing well.’
ai-mn27:4.2_0: Take some clever aristocrat who I see some clever aristocrats who are subtle, accomplished in the doctrines of others, hair-splitters. ...
ai-mn27:4.4_0: ‘So, gentlemen, that ascetic Gotama will come down to such and such village or town.’
ai-mn27:4.6_0: ‘We’ll approach the ascetic Gotama and ask him this question.
ai-mn27:4.7_0: and if he answers like that, we’ll refute him like this.
ai-mn27:4.8_0: and if he answers like that, we’ll refute him like this.’
ai-mn27:4.12_0: The ascetic Gotama educates, encourages, fires up, and inspires them with a Dhamma talk.
ai-mn27:4.13_0: They don’t even get around to asking their question to the ascetic Gotama, so how could they refute his answer?
ai-mn27:4.15_0: When I saw this first footprint of the ascetic Gotama, I drew the conclusion,
ai-mn27:4.16_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha. The teaching is well explained. The Saṅgha is practicing well.’
ai-mn27:5.1_0: Furthermore, I see some clever brahmins ...
ai-mn27:7.1_0: Furthermore, I see some clever ascetics who are subtle, accomplished in the doctrines of others, hair-splitters. ...
ai-mn27:7.3_0: ‘So, gentlemen, that ascetic Gotama will come down to such and such village or town.’
ai-mn27:7.4_0: They answered their questions, ‘We’ll ask him this question.’
ai-mn27:7.5_0: and if he answers like that, we’ll refute him like this.
ai-mn27:7.6_0: and if he answers like that, we’ll refute him like this.’
ai-mn27:7.7_0: They hear that the ascetic Gotama has come down to such and such village or town.
ai-mn27:7.9_0: The ascetic Gotama educates, encourages, fires up, and inspires them with a Dhamma talk.
ai-mn27:7.10_0: They don’t even get around to asking their question to the ascetic Gotama, so how could they refute his answer?
ai-mn27:7.11_0: Invariably, they ask the ascetic Gotama for the chance to go forth.
ai-mn27:7.12_0: And he gives them the going-forth.
ai-mn27:7.13_0: Soon after going forth, living withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, they realize the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. They live having achieved with their own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-mn27:7.15_0: ‘We were almost lost! We almost perished!
ai-mn27:7.16_0: For we used to claim that we were ascetics, brahmins, and perfected ones, but we were none of these things.
ai-mn27:7.17_0: But now we really are ascetics, brahmins, and perfected ones!’
ai-mn27:7.18_0: When I saw this fourth footprint of the ascetic Gotama, I drew the conclusion,
ai-mn27:7.19_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha. The teaching is well explained. The Saṅgha is practicing well.’
ai-mn27:7.20_0: It’s because I saw these four footprints of the ascetic Gotama that I drew the conclusion,
ai-mn27:7.21_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha. The teaching is well explained. The Saṅgha is practicing well.’”
ai-mn27:8.1_0: When he had spoken, Jāṇussoṇi got down from his chariot, arranged his robe over one shoulder, knelt on his right knee, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and expressed this heartfelt sentiment three times,
ai-mn27:8.2_0: “Reverence to that Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-mn27:8.3_0: Reverence to him, the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-mn27:8.4_0: Homage to that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!
ai-mn27:8.5_0: Hopefully, some time or other I’ll get to meet Master Gotama, and we can have a discussion.”
ai-mn27:9.1_0: Then the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-mn27:9.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-mn27:9.3_0: and informed the Buddha of all they had discussed.
ai-mn27:9.4_0: When he had spoken, the Buddha said to him,
ai-mn27:9.5_0: “That’s not how the elephant’s footprint has not been completed in detail.
ai-mn27:9.6_0: As to how it is completed in detail,
ai-mn27:9.7_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-mn27:10.1_0: “Suppose that an elephant tracker were to enter an elephant wood.
ai-mn27:10.2_0: There he’d see a large elephant’s footprint, long and broad.
ai-mn27:10.3_0: A skilled elephant tracker wouldn’t yet come to the conclusion,
ai-mn27:10.4_0: ‘This must be a big bull elephant.’
ai-mn27:10.6_0: Because in an elephant wood there are dwarf she-elephants with big footprints, and this footprint might be one of theirs.
ai-mn27:10.8_0: They keep following the track until they see a big footprint, long and broad, and, high up, signs of usage.
ai-mn27:10.9_0: A skilled elephant tracker wouldn’t yet come to the conclusion,
ai-mn27:10.10_0: ‘This must be a big bull elephant.’
ai-mn27:10.12_0: Because in an elephant wood there are tall she-elephants with long trunks and big footprints, and this footprint might be one of theirs.
ai-mn27:10.14_0: They keep following the track until they see a big footprint, long and broad, and, high up, signs of usage and tusk-marks.
ai-mn27:10.15_0: A skilled elephant tracker wouldn’t yet come to the conclusion,
ai-mn27:10.16_0: ‘This must be a big bull elephant.’
ai-mn27:10.18_0: Because in an elephant wood there are tall and fully-grown she-elephants with big footprints, and this footprint might be one of theirs.
ai-mn27:10.20_0: They keep following the track until they see a big footprint, long and broad, and, high up, signs of usage and tusk-marks.
ai-mn27:10.21_0: And they see that bull elephant walking, standing, sitting, or lying down at the root of a tree or in the open.
ai-mn27:11.1_0: In the same way, brahmin, a Realized One arises in the world, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.
ai-mn27:11.2_0: He realizes with his own insight this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—and he makes it known to others.
ai-mn27:11.3_0: He proclaims a teaching that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing.
ai-mn27:11.3_1: and explains the spiritual life which is complete, full and pure.
ai-mn27:12.1_0: A householder hears that teaching, or a householder’s child, or someone reborn in some good family.
ai-mn27:12.2_0: After hearing that teaching they gain faith.
ai-mn27:12.4_0: ‘Living in a house is cramped and dirty, but the life of one gone forth is wide open.
ai-mn27:12.5_0: It’s not easy for someone living at home to lead the spiritual life utterly full and pure, like a polished shell.
ai-mn27:12.6_0: Why don’t I go forth from the lay life to homelessness?’
ai-mn27:12.7_0: After some time they give up a large or small fortune, and a large or small family circle. They shave off hair and beard, dress in ocher robes, and go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-mn27:13.1_0: Once they’ve gone forth, they give up the training and livelihood of the mendicants. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re scrupulous and kind, living full of compassion for all living beings.
ai-mn27:13.2_1: They take only what’s given, and expect only what’s given. They keep themselves clean by not thieving.
ai-mn27:13.3_0: They give up unchastity. They are celibate, set apart, avoiding the common practice of sex.
ai-mn27:13.4_0: They give up lying. They speak the truth and stick to the truth. They’re honest and trustworthy, and don’t trick the world with their words.
ai-mn27:13.5_1: He doesn’t repeat in one place what he heard in another so as to divide people against each other. Instead, he reconciles those who are divided, supporting unity, delighting in harmony, loving harmony, speaking words that promote harmony.
ai-mn27:13.6_1: They speak in a way that’s mellow, pleasing to the ear, lovely, going to the heart, polite, likable and agreeable to the people.
ai-mn27:13.7_0: They give up talking nonsense. Their words are timely, true, and meaningful, in line with the teaching and training. They say things at the right time which are valuable, reasonable, succinct, and beneficial.
ai-mn27:13.8_0: They refrain from injuring plants and seeds.
ai-mn27:13.9_0: They eat in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night and at the wrong time.
ai-mn27:13.10_0: They avoid dancing, singing, music, and seeing shows.
ai-mn27:13.11_0: They avoid beautifying and adorning themselves with garlands, perfumes, and makeup.
ai-mn27:13.12_0: They avoid high and luxurious beds.
ai-mn27:13.13_0: They refrain from receiving gold and money,
ai-mn27:13.22_0: They avoid running errands and messages;
ai-mn27:13.26_0: mutilation, murder, abduction, banditry, plunder, and violence.
ai-mn27:14.1_0: They’re content with robes to look after the body and alms-food to look after the belly.
ai-mn27:14.1_1: Wherever they go, they set out taking only these things.
ai-mn27:14.2_0: Like a bird: wherever it flies, wings are its only burden.
ai-mn27:14.3_0: In the same way, a mendicant is content with robes to look after the body and alms-food to look after the belly.
ai-mn27:14.3_1: Wherever they go, they set out taking only these things.
ai-mn27:14.4_0: When they have this entire spectrum of noble ethics, they experience a blameless happiness inside themselves.
ai-mn27:15.1_0: Seeing a sight with the eyes, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-mn27:15.2_0: If the faculty of sight were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming. For this reason, they practice restraint, protecting the faculty of sight, and achieving its restraint.
ai-mn27:15.3_0: When you hear a sound with your ears ...
ai-mn27:15.4_0: When they smell an odor with their nose ...
ai-mn27:15.5_0: Tasting a flavor with the tongue ...
ai-mn27:15.6_0: Feeling a touch with the body ...
ai-mn27:15.7_0: Knowing a thought with their mind, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-mn27:15.8_0: If the faculty of mind were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming. For this reason, they practice restraint, protecting the faculty of mind, and achieving its restraint.
ai-mn27:15.9_0: When they have this noble sense restraint, they experience an unsullied bliss inside themselves.
ai-mn27:16.1_0: They act with situational awareness when going out and coming back; when looking ahead and aside; when bending and extending the limbs; when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes; when eating, drinking, chewing, and tasting; when urinating and defecating; when walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, waking, speaking, and keeping silent.
ai-mn27:17.1_0: When they have this noble spectrum of ethics, this noble sense restraint, and this noble mindfulness and situational awareness,
ai-mn27:17.2_0: they frequent a secluded lodging—a wilderness, the root of a tree, a hill, a ravine, a mountain cave, a charnel ground, a forest, the open air, a heap of straw.
ai-mn27:18.1_0: After the meal, they return from alms-round, sit down cross-legged with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there.
ai-mn27:18.2_0: Giving up desire for the world, he meditates with a heart rid of desire, cleansing the mind of desire.
ai-mn27:18.3_0: Giving up ill will, they meditate with a mind rid of ill will, full of compassion for all living beings, cleansing the mind of ill will and malevolence.
ai-mn27:18.4_0: Giving up dullness and drowsiness, they meditate with a mind rid of dullness and drowsiness, perceiving light, mindful and aware, cleansing the mind of dullness and drowsiness.
ai-mn27:18.5_0: Giving up restlessness and remorse, they meditate without restlessness, their mind peaceful inside, cleansing the mind of restlessness and remorse.
ai-mn27:18.6_0: Giving up doubt, he meditates having gone beyond doubt, not undecided about skillful qualities, cleansing the mind of doubt.
ai-mn27:19.1_0: They give up these five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom.
ai-mn27:19.2_0: Then, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, they enter and remain in the first absorption ...
ai-mn27:19.3_0: This too is called ‘a footprint of the Realized One’ ...
ai-mn27:19.4_0: But a noble disciple wouldn’t yet come to the conclusion,
ai-mn27:19.5_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha. The teaching is well explained. The Saṅgha is practicing well.’
ai-mn27:20.1_0: Furthermore, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, a mendicant enters and remains in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-mn27:20.2_0: This too is called ‘a footprint of the Realized One’ ...
ai-mn27:20.3_0: the Fortunate One’s Saṅgha of disciples are good in their practice.’
ai-mn27:21.1_0: Furthermore, with the fading away of rapture, a mendicant enters and remains in the third absorption, where they meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’
ai-mn27:21.2_0: This too is called ‘a footprint of the Realized One’ ...
ai-mn27:21.3_0: the Fortunate One’s Saṅgha of disciples are good in their practice.’
ai-mn27:22.1_0: Furthermore, giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, a mendicant enters and remains in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-mn27:22.2_0: This too is called ‘a footprint of the Realized One’ ...
ai-mn27:22.3_0: But a noble disciple wouldn’t yet come to the conclusion,
ai-mn27:22.4_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha. The teaching is well explained. The Saṅgha is practicing well.’
ai-mn27:23.1_0: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward recollection of past lives. ...
ai-mn27:23.2_0: They recollect many kinds of past lives.
ai-mn27:23.2_1: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-mn27:23.3_0: This too is called ‘a footprint of the Realized One’ ...
ai-mn27:23.4_0: But a noble disciple wouldn’t yet come to the conclusion,
ai-mn27:23.5_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha. The teaching is well explained. The Saṅgha is practicing well.’
ai-mn27:24.1_0: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings.
ai-mn27:24.2_0: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-mn27:24.3_0: This too is called ‘a footprint of the Realized One’ ...
ai-mn27:24.4_0: But a noble disciple wouldn’t yet come to the conclusion,
ai-mn27:24.5_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha. The teaching is well explained. The Saṅgha is practicing well.’
ai-mn27:25.1_0: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward knowledge of the ending of defilements.
ai-mn27:25.2_0: But they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ...
ai-mn27:25.3_0: He truly understands: ‘These are defilements’ ... ‘This is the origin of defilements’ ... ‘This is the cessation of defilements’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of defilements’.
ai-mn27:25.4_0: This too is called ‘a footprint of the Realized One’ ...
ai-mn27:25.5_0: At this point a noble disciple has not yet come to a conclusion, but they are coming to a conclusion,
ai-mn27:25.6_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha. The teaching is well explained. The Saṅgha is practicing well.’
ai-mn27:26.1_0: Knowing and seeing like this, their mind is freed from the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
ai-mn27:26.2_0: When it is freed, he knows it is freed.
ai-mn27:26.3_0: He understands: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
ai-mn27:26.4_0: This too is called ‘a footprint of the Realized One’ ...
ai-mn27:26.5_0: At this point a noble disciple has come to the conclusion,
ai-mn27:26.6_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha. The teaching is well explained. The Saṅgha is practicing well.’
ai-mn27:26.7_0: And it is at this point that the simile of the elephant’s footprint has been completed in detail.”
ai-mn27:27.1_0: When he said this, the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi said to the Buddha,
ai-mn27:27.3_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what had been hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that
ai-mn27:27.3_1: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-mn27:27.3_2: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the dear Gotama in countless ways.
ai-mn27:27.4_0: Good Gotama, I go for refuge to you, and to the Teaching and to the Sangha of monks.
ai-mn27:27.5_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-mn27:27.6_0: The Shorter Discourse on the Footprints is finished.
